title.narrative: WASH IN SCHOOLS AND CLINICS

description.narrative: Government provides safe water and sanitation services in more health and education facilities, particularly in the most vulnerable districts., which contributes to Hygiene, Sanitation, Wash In Schools And Ecd Centres, Wash â€“ General, Water, Water Supply. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Children aged 6-17 access timely and quality early childhood education, basic and post-basic education in humanitarian situations in Iraq

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Government provides safe water and sanitation services in more health and education facilities, particularly in the most vulnerabledistricts.

description.narrative: A total of 139,744 children, including those with disabilities have improved access to adequate water and improved hygiene through rehabilitation of WASH facilities in 263 primary schools. In addition, 350,890 children and their families by have adequate access to WASH facilities in 102 primary Health Care facilities in targeted governorates | Status:Constrained | As-of Date:15/01/2019
